intro: Cnemidaria ewanii, commonly known as the Ewan's grasshopper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. Native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in open grasslands and rocky habitats, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
